{ FARMING IN LEIGH AND BRANSFORD (1)
Within living memory most of the land was covered with apple and cherry {orchards}and{hopyards. }Indeed, the 1961 ordnance survey map indicates that there were still large acreages of fruit. Today, however, most of the orchards have disappeared and the hopyards are being abandoned.
Formerly fruit was transported by lorry to markets in places such as Manchester and Glasgow, but now it is usually sold on a{"pick_your_own" basis.
Most of the land is now turned over to the cultivation of{wheat, {oats, barley}and{grassland.
